definition: special/unique/distinguished/especially/unusual/very/abbr. for 特克斯[te4 ke4 si1], tex

sentences.english: Some close-ups of cadets and instructors.
sentences.chinese: 以下是學員和指導員的特寫鏡頭。

sentences.english: Close-up of Statue of Liberty in New York City on Nov. 1, 1983. (AP Photo/ Dave Pickoff)
sentences.chinese: 1983年11月1日，紐約自由女神像的特寫。

sentences.english: He's worth three chapters in a textbook.
sentences.chinese: 他的功勳彪炳，值得在教科書裏大寫特寫。

sentences.english: Areas outlined in yellow delineate close-up views on the right.
sentences.chinese: 對黃框內區域的景觀特寫則呈現爲右面的兩張圖片。

sentences.english: I'm going to zoom in for a close-up.
sentences.chinese: 我要拉近鏡頭來個特寫。

sentences.english: Here’s a closeup of the toolbar.
A close-up lens is ideal for taking close-up pictures.
sentences.chinese: 近攝鏡用來手特寫照片最理想。

sentences.english: The camera moved in on the hero for a closeup sequence.
sentences.chinese: 攝影機向男主角移近，準備拍一組特寫鏡頭。

sentences.english: Software Description: About Audubon Close Up - Nesting Birds, This screen saver includes close-ups of Audubon birds.
sentences.chinese: 這個屏幕保護程序包括奧特朋的鳥兒特寫鏡頭。

sentences.english: Software Description: About Safeway Flowers I, This is a close-up of a small pink carnation.
sentences.chinese: 這是一束小粉紅的康乃馨的一個特寫鏡頭。

sentences.english: A close-up of a mounted blue morpho butterfly shows its unique iridescent sheen.
sentences.chinese: 一張藍大閃蝶的特寫展示了它獨特的彩虹光澤。

sentences.english: Get CLOSE UP of steaming water being poured.
sentences.chinese: 給傾倒中冒着熱氣的水特寫。

sentences.english: A close-up shot of the actress reveals wrinkles round her eyes and a sign of fatigue.
sentences.chinese: 特寫鏡頭露出了女演員眼角的皺紋，她略顯疲憊。

sentences.english: Maybe we see a close-up of her boot.
sentences.chinese: 或許我們看到的是她的靴子的特寫鏡頭。

sentences.english: Every pane of glass in the facade depicts a large format close-up of a quarry.
sentences.chinese: 立面的每一塊玻璃上都印製着大幅面的石材特寫。

sentences.english: Only one-fifth of my collection is featured in the book.
sentences.chinese: 這本書中只特寫了我五分之一的收藏。

definition: scene/tableau/picture/image/screen (displayed by a computer)/(motion picture) frame/field of view
camera lens/camera shot (in a movie etc)/scene
to gaze at/to fix one's eyes on
photogenic/to appear on film or in the media
line (in drawing, calligraphy etc)/the lines or contours of a three-dimensional object (hairstyle, clothing, car etc)
